messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:50): huh, brief power black out in mountain view
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:50): i wonder what that was about
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (10:53): my bet: the PROJECT has escaped ;)
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (10:53): cue x-files melody
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:55): nobody twittered about it that i can see, so... maybe just the complex i'm in
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:06): i should get a UPS
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:06): that power outage ruined by 250+ day uptime
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:06): (on the box linux box routing all my network traffic, which i installed about 250 days ago)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (11:07): I wonder if development of the 'uptime' program was secretly supported by the people who make UPS devices
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:08): hah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:09): are UPSes any good these days? 15 years ago they could barely do 7 minutes for your typical load
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:10): wow, apparently not
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:10): 3 minutes?!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:10): 5 minutes?!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:11): $378 for less than 7 minutes at barely 1kW?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:14): my _iPod_ can last a whole day, and it fits in my pocket
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (11:15): my g1 lasts a whole hour, and it fits in my - OH WAIT :D

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:15): surely something that can be put under a desk, that doesn't need to handle continuous drain-charge cycles, and that is plugged into the mains most of the day, can do better
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:16): i wonder how much petrol would be needed for a generator to support a 1kW load for an hour
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:17): surely we have rechargeable materials with more efficient power densities than petrol by now
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:17): grumbles at hardware people :-P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:18): i was buying a printer recently and as far as i could tell, they essentially haven't improved in 10 years
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:19): and now i find UPSes haven't improved in like 15 years
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:19): i know chips improve, and laptops improve, and software sure has improved, and network connectivity has improved
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:19): so wtf are the printer and UPS people doing?!
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (11:22): working on their uranium-powered printers in their secret lair ? ;)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:22): i hope so
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:22): when they finally release something new, it had better be effing AWESOME.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (11:23): like bre-pettis-AWESOME :D
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (11:23): thats it. printer people worked on adding more dimensions to their plotters !

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:24): i expect hte next gen printers to be able to print onto a whole ream of paper at once without moving any of the sheets, so that you just stick a ream in, and then you pick it up three seconds later and the whole ream is fully printed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:24): DOUBLE-SIDED.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:25): and the next gen UPS had better just be a cable you can replace your current cable with
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (11:25): nono, they print the paper as well
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:25): which lasts 72 hours on one charge, charges in 5 seconds, and can support 10MW loads.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (11:26): looks like you're going for an Uranium Power Supply there ‚Ä¶
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:39): wow, the comments from some of the CSSWG memebers regarding selectors api on public-webapps/www-style seem surprisingly confused about how it works.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:40): also about the use cases that are being addressed, but that's slightly more understandable if they haven't actively followed its development
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:42): I suppose I should clearly document all of those somewhere, outside of the mailing list discussion, for easy reference.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:42): I'll put it on the whatwg wiki
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:48): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, build your own UPS out of an array of car batteries. They should last quite a while, if you have enough.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (11:49): You could just use a laptop
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:52): http://www.dansdata.com/upsupgrade.htm or http://www.dansdata.com/diyups.htm
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:55): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: the laptops didn't die, but it turns out they're useless without the wireless router and the cable modem
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:56): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: and the mac mini stops being entertaining when it, its media disk, its speakers, and its screen all go off at once
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:00): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, is a mac mini particularly entertaining for some reason when it's on?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:01): perhaps if you use it as a media centre
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:01): it's my tv replacement
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:01): and music player
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:02): and all around entertainment system
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:06): You could use laptops with one laptop acting as a wireless router, connected to the internet via the mobile phone network
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:06): Also, you could entertain yourself by reading a book
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:06): So there's really no reason to worry about power cuts at all
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:07): (Well, for the book you might need some candles too)
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (12:08): where can I find the documentation for html5lib?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:10): dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff: import html5lib; help(html5lib)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:10): (from Python interpreter)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:10): seems to be about the only documentation, given that the wiki seems to have lost its pages
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (12:11): ok, thanks
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:13): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: what are these "candles" you speak of
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:13): isn't that a unit of brightness

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:16): candles are a fire hazard, especially because you need a few hundred of them to replicate the amount of light obtained from a decent 100W incandescent bulb (or equivalent).
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:22): It's possible to see quite adequately without needing the equivalent of a 100W incandescent bulb
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:23): isn't suggesting using them as an identical replacement for current electrical lighting systems
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:30): dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff: There is some documentation somewhere but it got lost at some point
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:32): http://html5lib.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/UserDocumentation.wiki
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:32): (it may not be entirely up to date)
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (12:33): ah, thanks
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:39): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: Do you know why that doesn't show up on the web page?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:40): (http://code.google.com/p/html5lib/w/list links to UserDocumentation but says page not found)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:40): Maybe it's a SVN vs Hg thing?

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:47): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, trying to read in rooms that have less light than that from a 100W bulb, or better yet, long fluroescent tube lighting, can get quite tiring for my eyes.
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (12:49): Well, you could use the light to illuminate the book and not the entire room
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:53): has a 20W desk lamp that's easily more than adequate

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:59): I know what everyone finds comfortable is different, but I can't work with desk lamps. They give an uncomfortable bright spot while the rest of the room is comparitively dark.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:07): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: I guess it must be but I think it worked for a while after we switched (but I could be wrong about that)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:07): (however I blame Google anyway)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:07): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: You need smaller rooms
